statement: Monthly rent is considered a fixed expense in a budget.
According to the 50/30/20 budgeting rule, 50% of your income should go toward savings and debt repayment.
An emergency fund is primarily used for planned purchases like vacations.
Compounding allows you to earn interest on both your initial deposit and the interest you’ve already earned.
Checking accounts are primarily used for daily transactions.
FDIC insurance protects your investment portfolio from stock market losses.
Your payment history has the greatest impact on your FICO credit score.
A higher Credit Utilization Ratio can help increase your credit score.
A fixed-rate loan has an interest rate that can change over time.
The Avalanche Method focuses on paying off debts with the highest interest rate first.
Diversification reduces investment risk by spreading money across different asset types.
Beta measures how often a company pays dividends to its shareholders.
An employer’s matching contribution to a 401(k) plan is optional and depends on employee participation.
Withdrawals from a Traditional IRA are tax-free during retirement.
A tax credit directly reduces the amount of tax you owe.
If you are in the 24% tax bracket, your entire income is taxed at 24%.
A deductible is the amount you pay before your insurance begins to cover costs.
Whole life insurance covers you for a specific period and does not build cash value.
Phishing scams use fake emails or messages to trick people into revealing personal information.
A Ponzi scheme uses money from new investors to pay earlier investors instead of generating real profit.
